data.title: The Community Foundation for Greater New Haven
data.meta_description: New Haven Healthy Start provides a continuum of services to pregnant women, mothers, fathers, and their infants to ensure healthy birth outcomes.
data.meta_site_name: The Community Foundation for Greater New Haven
data.text:
Ensuring the healthy birth of every child

Giving Babies a Healthy Start

New Haven Healthy Start (NHHS) helps ensure the birth of healthy babies with a continuum of services to pregnant women, recent mothers, fathers and their infants. Founded in 1997 as a program of The Foundation, NHHS is supported by a federal grant from Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA) Maternal and Child Health.

About New Haven Healthy Start

Helping Children and Families Thrive

For the Community

The NHHS Consortium provides a platform for the community to learn and understand conditions that impact family health. We invite community members to participate in discussions and activities to improve conditions that impact families and the services they receive. Everyone is welcome.

Meetings take place the third Wednesday of every other month (January, March, May, July, September, November) from 4 p.m. to 5 p.m. For more information or to join, contact New Haven Healthy Start Administrative Officer Cynthia Chan.

Email Cynthia
